thread.title: FOOTBALL ROUNDUP: Both Carroll, Trimble dealt losses | High School | madisoncourier.com
thread.title_full: FOOTBALL ROUNDUP: Both Carroll, Trimble dealt losses | High School | madisoncourier.com

author: PAXTON MEDIA GROUP
title: FOOTBALL ROUNDUP: Both Carroll, Trimble dealt losses | High School | madisoncourier.com
text:
Carroll County football suffered a 50-9 loss on the road at Bourbon County on Friday in Paris.
The Panthers’ scoring was limited to a 29-yard field goal by Yerson Aguilar with 6:58 left in the first quarter and a 2-yard touchdown run by Karson Vaught with 2:06 left before halftime with the PAT blocked to send the Colonels into the intermission leading 30-9.
Bourbon (7-1) outgained the Panthers 380 yards to 103 including 177-23 on the ground and 203-80 in the air. Senior running back Shayne Bowling rushed nine times for 131 yards and a touchdown and senior quarterback Malachi Rennie had four keepers for 18 yards and two scores while Bryson Carr added one 12-yard carry for a touchdown.
Rennie also passed 26 times for 12 completions, 180 yards and a score. Junior backup Julius Gregory was 2-of-4 passing for 23 yards and a score. Senior receiver Jacob Ezell caught three passes for 70 yards and a touchdown to lead Bourbon and Quinton Rice caught a 5-yard pass for the other TD with freshman kicker Silas McKinney going 6-of-7 on PATs.
Carroll, now 4-4 on the season, hosts unbeaten Lloyd Memorial on Friday. The 8-0 Juggernauts were responsible for Bourbon’s lone loss, 22-20 on Oct. 3, and enter the game off a 41-6 win over Henry County last Friday night.
Holy Cross shuts down Trimble
Trimble County was on the wrong end of a 58-0 loss to unbeaten Covington Holy Cross Friday on the road.
The Indians rolled up 338 total yards in the win while llimiting Trimble to negative net yardage on the night — eight yards passing and minus nine yards rushing — as Holy Cross was in on 10 tackles for a loss.
The Raiders also turned the ball over five times with three fumbles and two interceptions as the Indians inproved to 8-0.
Holy Cross sophomore quarterback Brian Ferguson completed 6-of-11 passes for 88 yards and three touchdowns and junior Max Hunt had a 9-yard pass for a score for the Indians.
Charles Oglesby ran seven times for 96 yards and two scores, Trevin Figgs had four carries for 39 yards and two scores and Dustin Wilson carried three times for 55 yards and a score. Kicker Gabriel Romito made 4-of-9 PATs for the other points.
Trimble, now 2-6 on the season, hosts Bishop Brossart Friday. The Mustangs (3-5) lost to Holy Cross in a 6-3 defensive showdown on Oct. 10 but enter the game off a 21-20 win at Ludow last Friday.
